thread.title: Driver in Milford crash charged with OUI - Massachusetts news
thread.title_full: Driver in Milford crash charged with OUI - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: Driver in Milford crash charged with OUI - Massachusetts news
text:
The driver of a car that crashed in Milford on Wednesday was operating the vehicle under the influence of narcotics, according to State Police.
Related Link Get today’s headlines right in your inbox The driver, 30-year-old Danika-Leigh Chapman, was taken to UMass Medical Center with minor injuries. Her two male passengers were taken to Milford Hospital with minor injuries, a press release from Massachusetts State Police said.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Chapman was charged with operating under the influence, possession of class A Ketamine, negligent operation of a motor vehicle, marked lanes violation, and using a motor vehicle without authority.
The crash occurred at roughly 7 a.m. Wednesday morning on I-495 north after the white Toyota Yaris hit the guardrail and rolled over, said police.
Another view: Entrapment in #Milford , I-495 NB at exit 20. pic.twitter.com/MMxWhcsf5E
— Dustin Fitch (@DustinGFitch) October 7, 2015 Traffic was backed up after the right hand lane was closed, but State Police cleared the scene by 8:30 a.m.
#MAtraffic Rollover crash, I-495 NB at Exit 20 in #Milford . Right lane closed. pic.twitter.com/leGZw0jqp4
— Mass State Police (@MassStatePolice) October 7, 2015
